FuncDef: The reset bgp vpn-target command resets BGP connections related to the VPN-Target address family. The reset bgp vpn-target command resets BGP connections related to the VPN-Target address family.
CLIs: reset bgp vpn-target { external | internal | <as-number> | <ipv4-address> | <ipv6-address> | group <group-name> }
reset bgp vpn-target { external | internal | <as-number> | <ipv4-address> | group <group-name> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a 2-byte AS number (number<1-65535>) or a 4-byte AS number (number<1-65535>.number<0-65535>).
For an integral AS number, the value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
For an AS number in dotted notation, the value is in the format of x.y, where x and y are integers ranging from 1 to 65535 and from 0 to 65535, respectively.

Resets the BGP connection with a specified peer.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an IPv6 peer address.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Resets BGP connections with the specified peer group.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").
